metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28861 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** Python 3.x through 3.10 has an open redirection vulnerability in lib/http/server.py due to no protection against multiple (/) at the beginning of URI path which may leads to information disclosure. NOTE: this is disputed by a third party because the http.server.html documentation page states "Warning: http.server is not recommended for production. It only implements basic security checks."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
libpython3.10 - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
python3.10 - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
python3.10-examples - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
python3.10-full - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
python3.10-nopie - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
python3.10-venv - 3.10.6-1~22.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-stdlib - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-testsuite - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-examples - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-full - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-nopie - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-venv - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This CVE has now been disputed by the upstream developers, marking remaining releases as not-affected

criterions.comment: python3.10 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10.6-1~22.04.1').
python3.11 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04').
